metadata.title: CVE-2023-43115 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In Artifex Ghostscript through 10.01.2, gdevijs.c in GhostPDL can lead toremote code execution via crafted PostScript documents because they canswitch to the IJS device, or change the IjsServer parameter, after SAFERhas been activated. NOTE: it is a documented risk that the IJS server canbe specified on a gs command line (the IJS device inherently must execute acommand to start the IJS server).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-43115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.5
ghostscript-x - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.5
libgs9 - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.5
libgs9-common - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5.5').
